;Li Heming, researcher at Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center

; < p style="text-align: left;">;Three years later, the domestic credit card market will open up to the outside world again.

;

;On November 19, 2023, the international credit card organization giant MasterCard’s holding company in China, MasterCard, obtained a bank card clearing business license and stated that Within 6 months, it will expand its member institutions in China and authorize the issuance and acceptance of MasterCard brand bank cards.

;

;This is a time when China’s credit card market is shifting from a race-and-spur rush to intensive farming. At the same time, China's credit card market as a whole faces the challenges of rising non-performing loan ratios and shrinking new card issuance volumes.

;

;As the second largest personal credit market after housing mortgage loans, how do commercial banks respond to the new situation of credit cards, a high-quality asset? Which card issuing bank has better risk management system and risk control effect? Which card issuer is more effective at retaining customers?

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center hereby conducts a multi-dimensional evaluation of the credit card business of 20 systemically important banks.

;

;Five dimensions, 12 sub-indicators

;

;Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center based on the public disclosure information related to credit card business of 20 banks in 2023. Based on this, the 2023 Credit Card Performance Ranking Index Evaluation System has been constructed. Consistent with the wealth management list, green finance list, digital finance list, data security list and life insurance efficiency list, the credit card quality and efficiency list indicator system designed by Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center is mainly based on quantitative and qualitative indicators, supplemented by external expert review and media factor.

;

;Among them, the quantitative and qualitative indicators include three major dimensions: business scale and growth, risk management, customer service and product innovation, with 12 sub-indicators, each sub-indicator. Indicators are given differential weights based on their importance. The total weight of quantitative and qualitative indicators is 70%. Among quantitative and qualitative indicators, business scale accounts for as much as 35%.

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center also invited 7 external authoritative experts to conduct an independent real-name review and scoring based on the overall understanding of each bank's credit card business, with a weight of 15%. At the same time, in order to encourage commercial banks to improve the transparency of information disclosure in the credit card field, the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center formed a media factor based on the feedback of 20 banks' credit card business on a special survey, with a weight of 15%.

;

;
;

;

;;

;

;Credit card quality and efficiency ranking indicator system (Liang Shuyi, Liu Yuyu/picture)

;

;

;

;Pay equal attention to scale, risk control and innovation

;

;The various dimensions of the credit card quality and efficiency list and the set quantitative and qualitative indicators below are explained as follows:

; < p style="text-align: left;">;(1) Business scale is an important reflection of the credit card strength of major banks. There are six sub-indicators under this dimension, namely the number of credit card issuances and their changes, credit card loan balances and their proportions, the number of credit card users, and the amount of credit card transactions. The total weight of the six sub-indicators is 35%.

;

;(2) Risk management is a necessary dimension to examine the comprehensive strength of each bank's credit card. There are three sub-indicators under this dimension, namely credit card non-performing loan balance, non-performing loan ratio and their changes. The total weight of the three sub-indicators is 18%. Among them, in order to highlight the efforts and effects of banks in controlling the non-performing loan ratio, based on the credit card loan non-performing ratio indicator, a change rate indicator of the credit card loan non-performing ratio is set to directly reflect the results of the measures taken by each bank.

;

;(3) Customer service and product innovation are inevitable choices for major banks to cope with the increasingly fierce competition in the credit card market. There are three sub-indicators under this dimension, namely bank card fee income, credit card complaints volume and their changes. The total weight of the three sub-indicators is 17%. Among them, the number of complaints about the credit card business and its changes can prove the customer's recognition of the bank's credit card business and is a negative indicator; bank card fee income directly reflects the use of the bank's credit cards in real transactions, thereby reflecting the bank's Credit card product innovation and customer service levels.

;

;Joint stock banks dominate the top three

;

;Comprehensive analysis of the quantitative and qualitative indicators, expert reviews and media factor scores of 20 banks, Southern Weekend New Financial Research The center has constructed the 2023 credit card quality and efficiency list.

;

;
;

;

;;

;

;Credit card quality and efficiency list (Liang Shuyi, Liu Yuyu/picture)

;

;

;

;The credit card quality and efficiency list shows that China Merchants Bank, China CITIC Bank and Guangfa Bank took the top three overall scores.

;

;China Merchants Bank ranks first in quantitative and qualitative indicators, expert review scores and media factors, and is the only company to receive "double perfect scores" from expert reviews and media factors. Bank of. The bank won the championship with a large lead of 12 points, which reflects the competitiveness of the bank's credit cards in all aspects such as business, finance and reputation.

;

;CITIC Bank narrowly defeated China Guangfa Bank with a slight advantage of 0.24 points. The two joint-stock banks ranked second and third in the credit card quality and efficiency list respectively. Together with Ping An Bank, which ranks fourth, in the 2023 new financial competitiveness sub-list released this time, the credit card quality and efficiency list is also the only sub-list in which a joint-stock bank has achieved the top four rankings.

;

;Although external review scores and media factors have partially weakened the influence of scale indicators on the list, only from the perspective of quantitative and qualitative indicator performance, China Merchants Bank, CITIC and GF The score is still in the top three. Among them, Guangfa Bank's credit card loan balance accounts for as high as 48% of the bank's personal loan balance, far exceeding its peers. This proves that the credit card business has a huge influence on the bank beyond its peers. At the same time, despite the overall contraction in credit card issuance, China CITIC Bank and China Guangfa Bank still maintained positive growth in card issuance, which also shows the considerable strength of the two joint-stock banks in the credit card business.

;

;The five major banks ranked among the top ten

;

;Although they were not among the top three, the five major banks of the China Construction Bank of China, Workers and Peasants, all ranked among the top ten, still showing that overseas There are major banks with overall strength in the credit card business. The credit card business of major state-owned banks started early and has a huge customer base. It has always been significantly ahead in the scale of credit card business. However, in recent years, with the fluctuation of credit card asset quality and the stricter supervision after the implementation of new credit card regulations, a large number of invalid and inefficient credit cards issued in the early stage have withdrawn from the market. In the midst of this ebb and flow, the scale advantages of large banks in various countries are gradually being eliminated.

;

;The credit card business is not as important to large state-owned banks as it is to joint-stock banks. Looking at the proportion of credit card loans in personal loans, the average proportion of credit card loan balances in the five major banks is 9%, while this indicator for the nine joint-stock banks is as high as 27%. In this sense, despite being at an overall disadvantage in entry time, asset size and customer base, joint-stock banks can occupy half of the credit card market, and their comprehensive competitiveness beyond their opponents is obvious.

;

;Therefore, the ranking of the five major banks in the credit card quality and efficiency list is appropriate.

;

;The leading city commercial banks are catching up

;

;The credit card scores of the five city commercial banks are highly differentiated. Among them, Bank of Ningbo’s comprehensive score is second only to ICBC, ranking 6th.

;

;In the first half of 2023, the bank's credit card issuance volume increased by as much as 40% year-on-year, ranking first among 20 banks; at the same time, the bank's credit card issuance volume increased by 40% year-on-year. The bank's credit card non-performing rate is only 1.19%, the best among peers; while maintaining an ultra-low credit card non-performing rate, the bank's credit card non-performing rate is still on a downward trajectory, which is even more difficult. This reflects that leading city commercial banks are working hard to catch up in the credit card business and have made great progress in some indicators.

;

;Compared to Bank of Ningbo, the other four city commercial banks all rank at the bottom, showing that they still have a clear gap with large and medium-sized banks in terms of comprehensive credit card strength. Affected by factors such as their short time in the credit card market, small business scale, and weak customer base, the four city commercial banks overall lagged behind in indicators such as credit card issuance volume and credit card loan balance.

;Half is ocean, half is land

;

;Leizhou Peninsula, at the southernmost tip of mainland China, faces Hainan Island across the sea. The writer Sun Pin came here and stayed for two years.

;

;When we arrived on the island, Sun Pin kept walking and looking, identifying every plant and animal one by one. She talked with local people of different ages and learned some Leizhou dialect. "Eating" means "exemption" and "problem" means "taking responsibility". She tried her best as a northerner to feel the temperament and character of this land and water.

;

;Leizhou Peninsula is filled with "witchcraft" temperament. Tianhou Temple and Mazu Temple can be found everywhere, and there are various other gods in each village. "Faced with such a huge thing as the ocean, human beings cannot help but be in awe and ask for its blessings." The worship of the ocean and the many gods it derives permeates many details of the daily life of people living near the sea. "The folk customs here The folklore is very peculiar, and I was very curious about it, so I had this idea at that time and wanted to write about this land-sea junction."

;

;In the novel collection "The Magician of the Sea" published in 2023, Sun Pin fictionalized a seaside village located at the southernmost tip of Leizhou Peninsula: Papaya Town. The first novel in the collection, "The Magician by the Sea," tells the story of a northerner who comes here to look for her brother who has disappeared for many years. For Sun Pin, searching is a very fascinating process. "You keep moving forward on a road. You don't know what kind of people and what kind of stories you will encounter ahead."

;

;So, this northerner met the old lady who asked her not to scare Jackfruit, "Jackfruit is very attached to people and likes to be touched and praised most"; she met Sister Mei who lived with many plants and animals, and saw her Taking the leaf cake to the grave in the woods, she believed that the ghosts of her family were living in the black cat; she also met a person who looked like a carp spirit. In order to make her believe her words, the carp spirit faced her before speaking. The Mazu statue enshrined in the house burns incense and worships the gods, "If I tell you in front of Mazu, there will be no lies."

;

;"In this small town, many boundaries are blurred. People, plants and animals, living people and dead people, and the ground and the underground can all travel back and forth with each other. All things have animism and live together in a big family..."

;

; "This place still has a barbaric temperament. On one side, it frequently draws out its swords to attack people, causing blood to splatter five feet away. On the other side, it believes in animism. Each village has its own gods, and each god's birthday is different. Similarly, the birthday of the gods is a grand festival for the whole village, collectively called the calendar. Thunder operas must be sung to the gods on the stage, fine wine must be offered to the gods, fresh boiled chicken must be prepared, and firecrackers must be set off all day long. , there is a lion dance, and there is an extremely grand ceremony for the wandering god, while the god just sits in his temple and quietly watches people wishing him a birthday." (;"The Magician on the Beach";)

;

;Nature is the cause and life is the effect. Being with the sea all day long gives the folk life in Leizhou Peninsula an atmosphere of fantasy and mystery, and hidden behind this is the huge powerlessness and loneliness of human beings when facing the ocean.

;

;When Sun Pin saw the sea for the first time, his reaction was no different from that of many inland people, "It's so big that you don't know what is hidden inside." Regarding living on land For people on earth, land means a stable life, walking and living on land, building ancestral halls and ancestral temples, and reproducing from generation to generation. And what is life at sea really like? Facing the huge, mysterious and unknown sea, how should people settle their "rootless" sea life that is destined to wander?

;

;Taking the ferry back and forth from Xuwen Port to Haikou, Sun Pin took a total of more than ten boats and tried to chat with the crew. Crew members are often very silent, especially ocean-going crew members. One or two years of sailing at sea often cause them to lose contact with their friends on land, and people on land gradually forget their existence. "This kind of life on board is separated from the land. They are a world of their own, a world on board." When talking to Sun Pin, a captain called himself a "seaman". She noticed the particularity of this term. "Not a crew member or a sailor, but a seaman." "This distinction is no longer a professional one, but a separation based on the fundamental standpoint of human beings."

;

;This loneliness will eventually Leading to what? Sun Pin discovered that after catching expensive fish, some fishermen would take the money from selling the fish and go to the city center, find a hotel room, eat some delicious food, spend the money and then go back to fishing. She heard that many ocean-going sailors were like this. When the ocean-going ship docked for supplies, they would disembark and desperately buy things. Sun Pin tried to explain the origin of this compensation mentality, "For example, fishermen may die when they go out to sea in a small boat. Under this kind of impermanent fear, once you have a chance to get rid of or relax, you will desperately want to compensate yourself. ." "Or it may be a very simple idea, spend the money as soon as possible, in case I die tomorrow."

;

;The sea is silent, and the people in the sea are silent. The ship is like a natural prison. "Because of the narrow space and its separation from the land, it is likely to become a prison, and the crew will become prisoners, enduring torture-like loneliness." "But, can we change it?" How can we understand it from another perspective? This closed and isolated space can actually be turned into a Thoreau-style cabin, a unique space suitable for philosophical speculation?" In the second chapter of the novel collection "Seagull Knight", Sun Pin fictionalized a The captain wears a suit, combs his hair every day, burns incense, drinks tea, and plays the piano. "He still behaves elegantly in a place where no one is around, just like a ghost duke dormant in an old castle... He is sometimes very easy-going, sometimes very..." He is gloomy and occasionally fierce. When he is in a good mood, he will talk about literature and art elegantly. There is something between noble and gloomy in him."

;

;She wanted to ask, when a person is in a In such a closed and lonely environment, how can we find a broader and richer spiritual space for ourselves?

;

;;

;

;In The Crack of Civilization

;

;Two years ago, Sun Pin's collection of novels "In the Name of Birds and Beasts" was published. Fan Xiaozhe, editor of People's Literature Publishing House, edited Sun Pin's book for the first time. "Whether she writes about the grand and lush plants in the south, the rich aquatic products in the ocean, or the uninhabited dense forests in the north, these things are just the material of Sun Pin's novels," Fan Xiaozhe said, "and in the end all novels point to modern times. Civilization (;Modernization, urbanization;) has an inner impact on people, and at the same time, they are looking back or questioning."

;

;In "In the Name of Birds and Beasts", Sun Pin turns his attention to the mountain people in his hometown of Luliang Mountain. There, modern urban civilization is constantly entering this "barbaric" land. Sun Pin created a mountain man named You Xiaolong. He walked out of the mountains and had a decent civil servant job in the town. But this profession did not provide him with a sense of identity. “His roots are still in the mountains.” In Sun Pin’s view, what You Xiaolong represents is the suffering suffered by some people in the process of urbanization. “They My soul has nowhere to rest, I can’t go back to my hometown, and the city doesn’t belong to me.”

;

;“Don’t you think this is the epitome of a large part of the people in China?” Sun Pin’s voice came from the other end of the phone. came, "Of course, urbanization is a necessary stage in the development of human society. But in fact, every step of development of the times requires the blood and tears of hundreds of millions of people."

;

;The focus on urbanization also continues Go to the third novel in the new collection of novels, "Sunset Coral". In the novel, Sun Pin meticulously recorded the urbanization process of Papaya Town: in the 1980s, 100,000 talents came to Hainan, and all the people in Papaya Town became small traders; in the 1990s, the Wenzhou real estate speculators allowed smuggled cars to invade and devour the entire town. And when the tourism and vacation trend started in Hainan Island, Papaya Town rushed to operate a coral B&B... Between the city and the countryside, Sun Pin once again chose the gap between civilizations as the perspective of her thinking. The protagonist "I" in the novel once walked from Papaya Town to the city. "I originally went to pursue modern civilization, but I could never really enter the city."

;

;From north to south, from the mountains and forests to the sea, in the literary geography Under the changes of migration, Sun Pin always paid attention to the spiritual state that is not limited by geography, that has a certain universal "solitude" - the personal spirit that is difficult to place in the gap between modern civilization and the turmoil of the times. Therefore, what Fan Xiaozhe said about "looking back" not only constitutes the writer's fundamental questioning of modern civilization, but also Sun Pin's inner connection with his own life experience.

;

;For Sun Pin, the "post-80s" generation, she feels that every change in the times has an impact on her and her generation. She witnessed workers being laid off during her childhood. As a teenager, she became a "hard-working problem solver in a small town." "By the time I graduated, the sense of superiority that still existed among college students in the 1990s had disappeared, and college students had turned into grains of dust." When she was in college, she would still think, "We have entered the 21st century, how can we still be there?" What is the difference between formal and non-establishment work?" After working for a short time, her thoughts changed. The cruel reality of society seemed to have taught her what life is.

;

;“Everything I have experienced and every change in society has definitely had an impact on me. And in the process, I am constantly thinking about the impact of each wave of the times. "Individual coercion," when these thoughts slowly accumulate, "you just want to express it." Sun Pin said.

;

;After graduating from university, Sun Pin successively published novel collections "Pain", "Salt" and "Crack". Many readers and critics noticed the pain of soul and spirit in his works. "Because you can only write about the pain if you really feel it, so I put high-concentration emotions into my early novels," Sun Pin said. As the title of the novel suggests, these creations reveal a young man's confrontation with society and the world, as well as his irreconcilable mental state.

;

;Looking back at her creations when she was in her twenties, Sun Pin felt that they were very normal and in line with a young person’s state of mind at that time and her understanding of the world. “When I didn’t understand society well enough, I walked into it. "Without society", what follows is the weakness and helplessness of individuals, as well as the rupture and impact when they suddenly fall from the ivory tower built by literature and education into reality and face life head-on.

;

;“It’s just that I can’t still burn my emotions as hard as I did when I was 20 years old at 40 years old. My novels when I was 20 years old focused on the deep and struggling hearts of young women. As I grow older, I will try to understand more people and pay attention to the wider world, which is interesting. Writers burn themselves throughout their lives, but later on, what I burn is no longer just emotions, It’s about a better understanding of this vast world.”

;

;While editing “In the Name of Birds and Beasts”, Fan Xiaozhe felt that Sun Pin “began to become more open-minded.” She believes, “In “Pain”, “Salt” and “Crack”, she paid more attention to individual pain, but starting from “In the Name of Birds and Beasts”, she combined some natural things, plants, mountains and rivers, including their backs The history of the world was brought out."

;

;Anthropological writing inspired her. In anthropology, Sun Pin saw a deeper and more contextual care for human beings. She wrote "In the Name of Birds and Beasts", using anthropological methods to deal with the changes in the mountains, the history of vegetation and mountains, and deeply describing the evolution of the lives of mountain people between the city and the mountains and forests. This persistent gaze on human beings and the world in which they live is full of patience and "the greatest respect for different people." And when she looked at these mountain people, fishermen and sea people with the same patience, these "wild" people in the eyes of urban civilization, she truly realized the unique vitality among them. In "The Rider of the White Horse" she wrote about all kinds of strange mountain people, the bachelor brothers who raised their adopted daughter together, the short man who ran a peasant university in the mountains... "You see, their living conditions are actually very difficult. You can also use the word barbaric to describe them," Sun Pin said, "but their language and their thoughts are full of vitality. That kind of vitality does not belong to cities and civilization, but it is equally sincere and moving."

;

;;

;

;Sun Pin collects scenery at the seaside of Xuwen's Bocheng Port;(provided by the interviewee/picture);

;

;Orientation A Wider World

;

;At the "Seaside Magician" new book sharing event, writer Li Jingze said: "Although Sun Pin's creation has changed a lot, I feel that her direction has not changed. There has always been an intention to establish a connection between people and all things, which is particularly important. A common situation in Sun Pin's novels is that as we walk, there are fewer and fewer people, and where there are few people, all things thrive."

;

;As he grew older, Sun Pin found that he was less interested in people. "When there is a lot of disappointment in people or human nature, or when one cannot find deep comfort in the crowd, this complex relationship between people will gradually become a cramped space that will constrain people."

;

;She got to know the plants and animals, the rivers she passed by, and tried to communicate with people who didn't speak Mandarin to try to understand them. "This itself is a very interesting process," Sun Pin said, "because you are gradually understanding the world, and this is actually very healing for people living in high-rise buildings." When she came to the mountains from the city Like the ocean, regional changes affect the state of mind of those who are in it. "You will become more and more tolerant."

;

;This change in the state of mind in life ultimately changed her creation. "My early novels were entangled in the relationships between people, and then I got a little tired of this kind of writing," Sun Pin said. "It doesn't make much sense to continue writing like this. I want to make some attempts and adjustments. Moreover, I think every writer’s attempt must have a premise that makes himself feel relaxed and happy, and has the function of healing and nourishing the author himself. It is impossible for a person to say that I write to do hard labor and write about those things. Things that I don’t want to write, even if it can bring more fame to the writer himself.”

;

;Sun Pin imagined himself becoming the fictional captain in “Seagull Rider”, trying to create a better , greater spiritual space - "Because writing itself is the healing and placement of oneself."

;

;"At that moment, I thought, if everything is really animistic, then a person After death, you just leave human society, but enter a broader world. In that world, plants, animals, mountains, rivers, sun, moon, oceans, hurricanes, gods, dead souls, monsters, and elves are all They can communicate with each other. This kind of communication cannot be seen by living people, but some traces are revealed in those who are lonely and traumatized..." (;"The Magician of the Sea";)

;

;"Escape and settlement exist at the same time," Sun Pin said, "You can understand this kind of escape as a result of people's Escape caused by the powerlessness of reality and the material world, but at the same time, in the process of escaping, you also construct a new world for yourself, a world that belongs to all things, no longer limited to human beings, but in the world of heaven and earth. Time."

;

;Questions still exist. Fan Xiaozhe believes that Sun Pin's creations always deal with her inner confusion. "First of all, she felt that communication between people in modern civilization is difficult, so she became confused." "In "Pain", "Salt" and " "In "Split", she started from her individual feelings and constantly wrote about confusion." "Later, she further inquired about the source of confusion. Is this a human problem or a social problem?"

;

;" At this stage, she did not look for answers among the crowd, but looked for them in all things." On the edge of modern civilization, in the depths of mountains, forests and islands that no one knows, those ships, sailors, mountain people, birds and beasts , are all self-consistent. "In all things, her confusion was diluted and alleviated, or healed."

;

;Sun Pin likes the "elf-like temperament" in Emily Dickinson's poems, and also likes Shen Congwen's poems. Writing, this kind of textual atmosphere is the state she yearns for, "In him, there is no trace of integration between human beings and all things in nature, very comfortable and natural stitching and connection."

;“Whistles sounded frequently at the scene, and a large number of police officers gathered together. They were wearing body armor, holding shields, and motorcycles. The sound of the car starting kept making a loud sound, and many people gathered around to watch."

;

;Recalling the scene a few days ago, the Nepali Mata still remembers it fresh.

;

;On November 23, 2023, thousands of people came to Kathmandu, Nepal, to hold a large-scale demonstration. "Restore the monarchy, abolish the republic," chanted protesters in Kathmandu, Nepal.

;

;According to local police estimates, about 9,000 people participated in the protest called by Durga Prasai, a former member of the Communist Party of Nepal (United Marxist-Leninist) and medical entrepreneur. Although police described the demonstration as "largely peaceful," two workers suffered minor injuries.

;

;Addressing the crowd later that afternoon, Prasai urged his supporters to break through the security cordon and march towards Maitigal. Police then used water cannon and tear gas to disperse the crowd.

;

;As political competition between the current republic and the pro-monarchy has intensified recently, the Nepali government has deployed about 10,000 security personnel from the Nepal Police, Armed Police Force and investigators to prevent the two groups from interfering. possible conflicts.

;

;The capital is "in chaos"

;

;Zhu Ming opened a restaurant in Nepal. He told Southern Weekend reporters that Nepal is an overall peaceful country, but in terms of certain political needs, Nepal There would be riots from time to time. Nowadays there are local police on every main street to maintain order.

;

;The young man Kariqi remembers clearly that the protest conflict took place at an intersection in the capital. People gathered and ran at the scene, and police sirens were heard continuously. “There was the sound of some kind of gunshots being fired, and there was an obvious Smoke Trail”.

;

;On that day, the local police fired 146 tear gas canisters and 5 rubber bullets to disperse Plase supporters in Barku.

;

;Plasse, who claims to be a maverick and has been adhering to anti-government and anti-corruption stances in recent times, said in a speech at the rally that Prime Minister Prachanda failed to rule the country and the country was heading towards bankruptcy and demanded that "He surrendered to the people."

;

;Plasse also claimed that his supporters would continue to hold protests elsewhere and would ignore Kathmandu's ban. Earlier, the government declared the Baneshwar stretch of Maiti as a no-go zone for protests. He said his campaign would not stop until the monarchy, the Hindu state and the 1990 constitution were restored.

;

;Plasse has long been considered a "controversial" businessman who is trying to overthrow Nepal's current government and calls the protests a "national rescue operation." He said the protests were against the government's failure to curb anarchy, corruption and rising inflation. Prashay wanted to restore the monarchy and the Hindu state by abolishing the current federal, republican and secular institutions.

;

;He also asked for the support of businessmen in the capital at the protest site, asking them to close their businesses from November 24.

;

;The youth wing of the Communist Party of Nepal (United Marxist-Leninist), the Rastiya Youth Party, and its student wing, the Nepal National Free Students Union, also participated in the demonstration in Tinkun. There are also many protesters who came to Kathmandu from the southern plains of Nepal. They are also "victims" of bank microfinance.

;

;Plasse said that banks are trying their best to exploit borrowers' money and called on people to give up their loans in banks.

;

;At the same time, demonstrators supporting the current republican regime also took to the streets. They believe that only a republic can guarantee social justice and equality and "allow everyone to have the opportunity to realize their dreams and pursuits."

;

;At the scene of the conflict, pro-monarchy protesters and counter-protesters clashed. The anger of the protesters spread from Barku, the designated protest area, to various areas such as Tinkunne, Garigaon, Sundara, Thapatali, Fudong and other key points.

;

;Subsequently, Kathmandu police arrested a total of 261 protesters, set up roadblocks and water cannons on the streets, and installed closed-circuit television to monitor Praset's supporters around the clock. Police have also deployed additional sniffer dogs around the conflict site and on rooftops to ensure safety and prevent possible incidents.

;

;In addition, in order to prevent conflicts between rival groups, the police designated two different protest areas. But the opposition between those who support the monarchy and those who support the republic is huge and will lead to heightened tensions.

;

;However, Zhu Ming said that the protests had little impact on local life. Because the protesters marched in designated areas, except for traffic closures during the march, other areas including the main business district and the World Tourist Center were not affected, and shops were open for business normally.

;

;Political systems in conflict

;

;Nepal, nestled in the Himalayas, has a rich and colorful culture, natural landscape and political history. But its political system evolved over the centuries, from a feudal monarchy to a federal democratic republic.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu, an associate researcher at the Institute of South Asia at Sichuan University, said that the current republic has indeed achieved certain positive results since its establishment, including the expansion of people's democratic rights and more protections.

;

;As early as the beginning of the 21st century, Nepalese politics underwent major changes. In 2006, Nepal's civil war ended and the government and rebels signed a peace agreement. Two years later, in 2008, Nepal officially declared itself a federal democratic republic, abolished the monarchy, the head of state became the president, and power was dispersed among the central government, federal state governments, and local governments.

;

;应邀在北京参加《希氏》第15版中译本首发式,左为责任编辑徐诚。

;

;《希氏内科学》在北京首发时，不能分册选购;（往常可以）;.购者还是纷至沓来，络绎不绝。有位老人早早地骑车从郊区赶来买书。他是工程师，家里也没有学医的人。我为他签名时提醒他这不是科普的书，但他还是坚持要买。以后我做《希氏》第17、18版补译工作时，领导居然决定，译稿先在一个综合性医学期刊上连载，随译随发;（为此增加了刊物篇幅）;，一年发完，再交出版社汇编出书。这个决定见报后，那年该刊的邮发量竟因此而增长了近三倍！这些都是现在无法想象也很难理解的。

;

;作为世界医学名著，《希氏内科学》已有意、日、西、葡等多种文字译本，各国翻译该书，都是上百人的专家班子集体翻译，从来没有一个人完成《希氏》全书翻译的。卫生部顾问、著名麻风病专家马海德;（美裔华籍）;说，海外媒体称王贤才是“中共十一届三中全会后冒出的'出土文物'（unearthed relics）”，问我有何观感。我说他们看到三中全会、改革开放的决定性作用是对的，但也不是我特别能干，是我的境况和经历决定了只能孤身拼搏。

;

;后记

;

;以后一些年里，我还译下了：

;

;《简明希氏内科学》第2版;（141万字;）。

;

;《希氏内科学》第17、18版补译本;（150万字）;。

;

;《西氏内科学》第21版全书;（600万字，因与西安世界图书出版公司合作，他们建议改“希氏”为“西氏”）;。

;

;《西氏内科学》第22版全书;（815万字）;。

;

;;

;

;陆续译出的不同版本的《希氏内科学》。

;

;连同最先出版的第15版《希氏》，我先后接触过9个不同版本，共计译成和出版2106万字。在迄今我的全部译著中，《希氏》系列约近其半；结缘可谓深厚了。

;

;我是2003年11月70岁时退休的。 《希氏》第22版;（815万字）;是退休后的译作。回顾我这一生，出版的主要译著15种37部约5000万字，可能是中国，也是世界上译著字数最多的人，因为发达国家是无需大量科技翻译的。

;

;;

;

;我和我的主要译著。前下是1957年最先出版的稚嫩的小书《临床外科须知》。它是丑小鸭，微不足道，但它引领了后来的那些译著，也开启了漫长的坎坷之路，所以我对它始终有着更多的感情。

;In the recently launched animated series "PLUTO" by Netflix, the audience once again saw the familiar robot Astro Boy from their childhood. This animated work depicts the existential crisis of humans and robots after the Central Asian War. The information is dense, neat and compact, and its lightness is as impressive as its heaviness.

;

;Hideo Kojima, the game producer and a well-known science fiction fan and animation fan, said, "This work is completely different from robot animations and hero animations that can only fight. This is Japanese manga (;Comics;), this is animation."

;

;The birth of ChatGPT made mankind realize that it may be replaced in the new technological environment Species crisis, the Palestinian-Israeli conflict caused tragic casualties. In this reality, "PLUTO" appeared: the shadow of the post-war period shrouded the entire earth, and Persia, which had lost its country, created the giant robot Pluto and wanted to destroy him. Seven of the world's strongest robots, including Astro Boy. In the fictional story, "war robot crisis" replaces "nuclear crisis", and "robot sanctions" replace "nuclear sanctions" in international politics.

;

;In 1964, Japanese cartoonist Osamu Tezuka released the special "Astro Boy" episode "The Strongest Robot on Earth". From the 1950s to the 1970s when Japanese comics were on the rise, most cartoonists of Tezuka’s generation took a left-leaning political stance because of their experience in World War II. They were anti-war, respectful of life, and advocating equality in their works.

;

;In 2003, with the permission of Osamu Tezuka's son, cartoonist Naoki Urasawa created "PLUTO" based on "The Strongest Robot on Earth". "PLUTO", born in 2023, is an animated series created by Netflix on this basis. From the anti-war thoughts in 1964, to the Iraq War in 2003, to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict in 2023, the three creations of "PLUTO" correspond to the war backgrounds of different eras.

;

;Japan has long allowed the world to accept the artistic language of comics. Tokiwa-so cartoonists headed by Osamu Tezuka have redefined the depth and breadth of comics. Their depiction and exploration of emotions have made their works Crossing the boundaries of the audience. Although "PLUTO" takes place in the context of a grand robot war, its setting is still classical: How can a robot become more like a human? On the one hand, humans are afraid of being replaced by machines; on the other hand, they are full of discrimination against androids - humans have emotions, and robots are just inferior species.

;

;Robot, are you really not sad? When robots cry, even they themselves are surprised. Who am I? Am I really grieving? Are these reactions emotions, or a set of codes?

;

;While watching this animation, I needed to press the pause button several times and stop for a while. Its perception and depiction of emotions are very innocent and beautiful, and sadness comes in an extremely light way. When Astro Boy is destroyed, will he be allowed to declare "death"? Or it can only be declared "damaged and scrapped". Naoki Urasawa continues Tetsuka's exploration of "the relationship between man and others", and still almost stubbornly depicts the possibility of "understanding" in a world full of fragmentation and disputes. For example, the robot North 2 went to the hometown of a stubborn artist to find the piano music in the artist's dream; the dinner between the robot Astro Boy and Dr. Pegasus; Ulan, who lost Astro Boy, could not face his own perception. The little robot keeps running around, trying to help sad humans.

;

;I haven’t seen such an animated work for a long time. The last time it gave me such an emotional experience was the animated film "Ghost in the Shell". Its English name is "Ghost in the Shell". Those whispers in the machine body may be just ghosts that are difficult to define, but it happened after all, didn't it?

; Sun, 03 Dec 2023 13:25:06 +0800 母亲起诉儿子返还购房款：对家庭是一个警示丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/261756
;;2023-12-03 11:50:00;
;

;According to CCTV's "Today's Statement" report, Yang's mother is a single mother, and her original condom was located in Dongcheng District, Beijing. The only house I have is my only son, Xiao Yang. She got 3.7 million from selling her house and transferred it to her son. She used it to buy a larger house in Tongzhou District, which she lived in and used as a wedding house for her son. Only her son's name was written on the property ownership certificate.

;

;In June 2019, Xiao Yang got married, and Yang’s mother lived with Xiao Yang and his wife in the new house. Soon after the marriage, the daughter-in-law had conflicts with Yang's mother over daily trivial matters. The relationship between Xiao Yang, who firmly stands by his wife, and Yang's mother continues to deteriorate. After that, Xiao Yang and his wife moved out of their new house. Later, because his wife had another quarrel with Yang's mother, Xiao Yang became angry and blocked Yang's mother on WeChat.

;

;In 2022, in order to solve the problem of her daughter’s schooling, Xiao Yang sent a WeChat message to her grandmother: “Sell the house in Tongzhou and let my mother use the money from her original sale to buy another house, and I will save money. Buy a house." "If my mother can't agree, I will go to court to sue my mother in one month. If it really goes to court, there will be no turning back on our mother-son relationship."

;

;Known After what her son said, Yang's mother said she was "completely heartbroken" and said she would be "homeless" if Xiao Yang sued her for obstruction. So Yang's mother sued Xiao Yang to return the purchase price of 3.7 million yuan for future pension purposes, and received the support of the court. This decision is in accordance with common law, or good customs.

;

;This is a typical case of the conflict between the extended family orientation and the small family orientation. The current statutory legal framework talks about the individual standard and the small family standard: the division of property is based on the boundaries between individuals and small families, and small families implement the "community property system"; parents have raised their children to adulthood and have done their best to support them. Adult children have the obligation to support their parents.

;

;Children who are minors must rely on their parents’ care, care and protection. Parents have custody and control over their children. When children become adults, they separate from their parents and form a nuclear family. If they get married and buy a house on their own, and do not receive support from their parents, nor do they expect to receive large amounts of property or inheritance from their parents, then the parents have not interfered with their children. A legitimate reason and effective starting point in life, children are "independent" from the extended family and gain the "sovereignty" of the small family. This is a normal intergenerational power transfer in a family.

;

;However, if on the one hand, the children get a large amount of support from their parents when they get married and buy a house, but on the other hand, they want to have a soft life and refuse their parents' interference in their lives (whether it is "suggestions" or "pointing fingers") Well, it’s actually the same thing), which essentially refuses parents to fulfill their “investor rights/powers”.

;

;As far as this case is concerned, the quarrel between the daughter-in-law and Yang's mother over "daily trivial matters" may have started because the daughter-in-law couldn't stand her mother-in-law's lifestyle, or she couldn't accept her mother-in-law's interference in the couple's lifestyle. The specific quarrel may have different rights and wrongs, but the underlying reason must be: the mother-in-law and daughter-in-law are fighting for the right to speak or dominate the house or the family, or one party believes that the other party has usurped his rights to the things in the house or the family. power or dominance. This is the essence of many conflicts between mother-in-law and daughter-in-law.

;

;There are a lot of poisonous chicken soups on the Internet nowadays, such as "A husband must stand for his daughter-in-law, otherwise he will be a mama's boy." This is probably because the daughter-in-law or the person who acts as the daughter-in-law by herself is online more, while the mother-in-law is less online, and the former has a higher voice. bigger. After Yang's mother paid 3.7 million yuan to provide a wedding house for the young couple, after the conflict between mother-in-law and daughter-in-law, the son did not reconcile the conflict, but blindly sided with the daughter-in-law, further intensifying the conflict, which shows that the son has nothing to do with his mother, who is an elder and investor. respect. There are many voices on the Internet who ridicule Xiao Yang for "taking a wife and forgetting her mother."

;

;After that, it was originally a tough and feasible plan to "sell the house in Tongzhou and let my mother use the money from her original sale to buy another house while I save money to buy another house." But at the same time, Xiao Yang threatened his mother with "prosecution" and "mother-child affection", which made her a little confused. During the court hearing, Yang's mother requested that the 3.7 million be recognized as a loan, while Xiao Yang requested that it be recognized as a gift from his mother, which seemed to contradict his promise.

;

;The court ultimately determined that the money was a loan. But even if it is a gift, it is conditional and can be withdrawn. Mother Yang gave the money to her son to buy a house and only wrote his son's name on it. What she really meant was not "I gave this money to you unconditionally. The house I bought will be written on your name." You can name it whatever you want." Instead, "Mom, I have given all my belongings to prepare a wedding room for you. I will live with you. You have to take good care of me when I grow old. I only write your name because I hope you can compare my feelings with mine. Not only do they have the right to live, they should also be respected.”

;

;The Xiao Yangs not only failed to manage intergenerational conflicts and despised the rights/rights of investors, but instead took the initiative to escalate conflicts and regarded their widowed mother as an enemy. Such a move is morally wrong, and it is unfair to weigh the interests and benefits. Sensible.

;

;It’s okay to adhere to individual orientation + small family orientation, and at the same time insist on living independently and rejecting large-amount funding from parents; if you accept large-amount funding from parents, you must respect the rights/powers of the investor, and even You must have the awareness to be a low-key child. Of course, high-profile parents may not intervene, but in this case, not intervening is a sign of affection, not a duty. "Having both" doesn't work.

;

;Furthermore, this case is also a warning to parents. By raising the children to adulthood, the parents' duty has been completed and the legal responsibilities have been fulfilled. You cannot hand over your old capital to your children casually, and your main assets must be in your own hands. If a child needs a large amount of financial aid, it can be lent in a clear way, stipulating the principal, interest and repayment plan, or at least it should be clear that the parents have the right to claim it back. Don't let the children feel that their parents' love for them is unconditional and they can take whatever they want.

;

;Parent-child love must be two-way. It is sad that many parents become the tools of their children, providing money and effort, and then being picked on and stabbed by their young couples.

; Sun, 03 Dec 2023 12:25:03 +0800 霞浦：摄影与旅游之间的距离http://www.infzm.com/contents/261748
;;2023-12-03 11:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Tourists take pictures of the sunrise at the seaside of Huazhu Village, Sansha Town, Xiapu County;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;Becoming a photography resort

;

;When the sunset was about to dissipate, a group of foreign photographers returned At the B&B on the mountain, we stood on the observation deck facing the coast and chatted. Looking down from the observation deck, there are still tourists taking pictures on the highway bridge at the foot of the mountain. Dongbi Village and Yugongting Village in Sansha Town, Xiapu County are famous for their sunset scenery.

;

;While waiting for the seafood banquet, a local member of the team introduced the owner of this B&B to the photographers, Zheng Dexiong, the president of the Xiapu Photography Association, the person who famously photographed the Xiapu beach. His last introduction was: , "The man who made Xiapu housing prices increase countless times."

;

;Facts are more powerful than words. An abandoned rural self-built house in Sansha Town can be sold for more than 100,000 yuan a year. Rented to B&B owners, if the property rights can be traded, the price of a house can be as high as several million. And B&B owners just for a piece of land, they knocked down their houses and rebuilt them, decorating them carefully. The price for a sea view room per night in the off-season is four figures. The skyrocketing housing prices have become a difficult problem for Sansha people who moved away due to lack of local industries in the early years.

;

;After greetings, Zheng Dexiong sat back on the outdoor seat on the other side of the observation deck and was busy planning the shooting schedule for another upcoming photography group. There were two more shoots arranged by the local government the next day. meeting. Everyone who comes to Xiapu for research and inspection wants to meet Zheng Dexiong.

;

;Before Zheng Dexiong, no one focused on tidal flat photography, and almost no one realized that the beautiful scenery of Xiapu was rare enough to be displayed. Zheng Dexiong, who has been engaged in commercial photography since the 1990s, was convinced of the uniqueness of Xiapu scenery after seeing many photos of seaside scenery. In 2002, Zheng Dexiong began photographing the tidal flats in his hometown in his spare time. Two years later, at the suggestion of a friend, he held the first photography exhibition in Xiapu on the street of Longshou Road. He also submitted articles to many photography magazines. His works were repeatedly published and won awards.

;

;Kasumigaura and its tidal flats are famous in the photography circle. Xiapu was rated as "the first of China's top ten landscape photography holy places". Photography bases were built in small fishing villages along the coast. Fishermen who were engaged in seafood fishing returned to the shore, and young people who went out to work returned to their hometowns and started the tourism industry from scratch. . Zheng Dexiong remembers that 20 years ago, Xiapu County had only one short street and no foreign population. But now the city has expanded all the way to the seaside, and Taikang Road filled with food stalls is busy until late at night. In 2022, Xiapu, with a population of just over 500,000, received 7.2 million tourists. A few photos changed the fate of a county.

;

;“It’s easy to say, but it’s not that simple. Over the past 20 years, we have actually invested a lot in transforming from private power to strong government support and from free services to a business model.” Zheng Dexiong objects to easy generalizations.

;

;When he first started photographing the tidal flats, Zheng Dexiong walked along the more than 400 kilometers of Xiapu coastline. It turned out that there were no roads on the shore and it was a barren mountain. He had to bring a machete and a hoe to open a road while walking. When shooting at Shajiang Pier, in order to find a shooting point with a suitable height, he climbed up from the bottom of the mountain. When he reached the top of the mountain, he discovered that there was a stone road built by the village on the other side. Several of Xiapu's early famous photography spots were discovered by Zheng Dexiong in this way.

;

;Zheng Dexiong paid for the early foreign photographers who came to Xiapu with his own money, until he could no longer afford the money. On May 1, 2007, he opened the first paid photography group. A one-week trip for 20 people cost more than 1,000 yuan per person. The local government saw the power of photography in the tourism industry and began to hold national photography competitions and create logos for photography spots. More importantly, the government has taken the lead in gradually building and improving supporting infrastructure for photography spots, including roads, parking lots, and observation decks.

;

;To this day, new photography spots are constantly being discovered. The 2017 edition of the "Xiapu Photography Guide" issued by the Xiapu Culture and Tourism Bureau lists 28 photography spots, and the number has increased to 33 in the 2021 edition. The infrastructure and tourism model around the photography spots have not yet been fully finalized, and both locals and tourists are adapting to the differences.

;

;;

;

;Xiapu tidal flat scenery through Zheng Dexiong's lens;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

; Perfect Photo

;

;The first people to profit from photography are the characters closely related to the shooting.

;

;Zheng Dexiong believes that shooting in Xiapu is a test of skills and experience. "The ebb and flow, changes in light and shadow, the alternation of four seasons, and different labor scenes in each season." This also means that shooting in Xiapu is uncertain. There are too many factors, including weather, tides, and seasons. The absence of any one element will lead to deviation from the default. Weather and tides can be grasped by experience, while labor scenes out of season can only be reproduced through performances.

;

;In the winter of 2005, a Taiwanese photographer came to Xiapu to take pictures, but the whole series was missing a picture of Xiaohao Village catching fish fry in spring. Considering that it was not easy to travel from Taiwan to the mainland, Zheng Dexiong asked local fishermen to cooperate in posing for photos. This is how the new profession of fishing model was born in Xiapu. To this day, even if no one buys fish fry anymore, the fishing models in Xiaohao Village still hold up a triangular fishing net frame every time they perform - this kind of special-shaped net is specially used to catch fish fry, and because of the award-winning photo shoot There are three fishing models, so the trio is also fixed.

;

;“Three people make a good photo.” Every time they perform, Bao Xuexian, who is in her fifties, her aunt in her seventies, and her aunt’s brother-in-law will put on knee-length rubber shoes, wearing Put on your straw hat, carry your fishing net and bamboo basket, and walk on the Xiaohao beach after low tide. The photographer would stand on the top of the mountain behind the village and shoot with a telephoto lens from a distance. Bao Xuexian's uncle Lin Jisong was responsible for reception on the mountain and conveyed the photographer's instructions to Bao Xuexian and others via radio.

;

;The performance fee for a performance is 300 yuan, and the fishing model costs 100 yuan per person. More than half of the days a month, people will be invited to perform, but Bao Xuexian does not think that fishing models are an enviable job. "Only those who can't make money become fishing models, and those who can make money go to cultivate oysters and grow seaweed." "When there are no performances, Bao Xuexian and her aunt weave fishing nets and sell them for money. A two-layered large fishing net sells for 31 yuan, and a three-layered one sells for 42 yuan. They can weave up to two per day.

;

;Lin Jisong receives guests at the top of the mountain, but does not participate in the distribution of performance fees. He has other income. Most of the people in Xiaohao Village were originally fishermen. Lin Jisong did not know how to fish. 24 years ago, he built a temple on the top of the mountain and made a living by collecting incense money. When fishermen go to sea, life and death are determined by fate, and they will worship gods before leaving. After the Xiaohao Tidal Flat became famous, the government built an observation deck on the top of the mountain, right next to the temple built by Lin Jisong. He felt that the angle of the path on the cliffside was better, so he paved a stone road and placed a few plastic stools. Anyone who goes to take pictures on the stone road must "donate" 10 yuan for the film fee.

;

;Famous photography spots have regular fishing models, such as Jiang Lianshui in Beiqi Tidal Flat and Lao Cheng in Yangjiaxi. They have taken award-winning photos together and know better than novice photographers about how to take photos. "They all know the angle, focal length, aperture, and speed." Zheng Dexiong found it very interesting. "Initially, we went to the village to select models. There were no special criteria. They just had to be fishermen."

;

;In the government building In front of the roads and observation decks, outsiders who come to take pictures of Xiapu have to find local photographers who know their way around. Photography directors came into being, referred to as photography directors. With supporting facilities in place, photography guides are still needed because outsiders can’t figure out the tide schedule and the best time to take photos at photography spots. Nowadays, the threshold for photography guides is much lower. Not only members of the local photography association, but also taxi drivers, travel agencies and villagers have joined in.

;

;In the early years, Zheng Dexiong also proposed to the Culture and Tourism Bureau to provide centralized training for people engaged in photography and photography to improve their service awareness and photography skills. Later, there were too many people and it was difficult to coordinate. When he was out shooting, Zheng Dexiong heard the cameraman introducing him to the tourists. They stood face to face and neither could recognize the other.

;

;;

;

;Tourists vacation at a B&B in Dongbi Village, Sansha Town, Xiapu County;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;Advantage Judgment

;

;In the minds of photographers, different photography spots have different ratings. Zheng Dexiong believes that although Xiaohao Village has the most award-winning films, the scenery does not change much and is the same regardless of the season; Huazhu Village only has sunrise, and the location is best only in winter, which is relatively monotonous; Beiqi Village can be photographed in any season. However, the pole frames for planting seaweed have been moved from the coast to the edge of the inland sea, and the beauty of the tidal flat patterns and pole shadows can no longer be photographed. The coast of his hometown, Dakyo Village, is more suitable for tourism than photography, because there are only beaches in that area and no tidal flats, and tidal flats are the core of Kasumigaura photography.

;

;What Zheng Dexiong likes most is the east wall. The scenery changes endlessly throughout the year. In 2019, Sansha Town invested 20 million to build a light and shadow plank road to connect the photography spots along the east wall, making this area more popular. When the tide goes out a few days after the first and fifteenth day of the lunar month, more people come to the road. I can't even stand on either side. The highway bridge where the Dongbi Photography Spot is located is on one side of Dongbi Village and on the other side is Yugongting Village. The two villages have become a gathering place for boutique B&Bs. Zheng Dexiong and his students all stay here.

;

;No matter what the photographer thinks, the villagers have their own way of judging their own advantages. Uncle Zhang, the owner of Huazhu in the countryside of Huazhu Village, was originally doing business abroad. In 2020, he returned to the village to run a B&B. He saw the potential of Huazhu. “Huazhu is a scenic spot for watching the sunrise. It is a must-go spot for anyone who comes to Xiapu. You must watch the sunrise. , you will most likely have to stay the night before." Uncle Zhang currently has 6 rooms, and the price per night is 400 to 600 yuan. According to his statistics, the occupancy rate is about 80%, and it is fully booked almost every day in the peak season.

;

;Another characteristic of Huazhu is that it is the Hokkien-speaking area of ​​this small town in eastern Fujian. Uncle Zhang talked about the history of Huazhu, starting from three hundred years ago, "Our ancestors were Those who moved from southern Fujian didn’t have big boats before. Fishermen fished along the coast and came all the way along the coast. Maybe they came here to escape the wind and rain. Later, they saw the abundant seafood here and settled down.” Huazhu Village speaks Hokkien and lives in stone houses. , pronounced "厝" in Hokkien. When building the B&B, the village committee required that the exterior appearance must retain the appearance of a house. Uncle Zhang plans to do a crowdfunding project to raise 8 million yuan to build 8 more B&Bs.

;

;;

;

;Bao Xuexian’s aunt is in her seventies. When she is not performing, she makes money by weaving fishing nets;(Southern People Weekly reporter Nie Yang Xin/Photo);

;

;After the light and shadow plank road was built on the east wall, Niulangang Natural Village was gradually lost, but they were not willing to lag behind. Niulangang Village is the opening point of Xiapu’s first boutique B&B CaoMuRen Teahouse. It has always regarded itself as the birthplace of Xiapu B&B and is close to the county seat and the entrance to the highway. The introduction reads: “It is surrounded by mountains and sea, with beautiful scenery and convenient transportation. The location advantage is obvious and the tourism resources are unique." In the summer of 2023, Niulangang Village began construction to build an asphalt road and a viewing platform on the mountain where B&Bs gather, hoping to regain the limelight as the first choice for tourists in the off-season. However, the construction team still started work during the Mid-Autumn Festival and National Day, which caused several negative reviews for surrounding B&Bs.

;

;The sightseeing route from Gaoluo Beach, Dajing Beach to Hawei Island is named Donghai Route 1. Although there are few photographers, it is the route recommended by everyone in Xiapu. According to the observation of Xiaona, a stall owner on Xiawei Island, the sea caves on Xiawei Island are the internet celebrity photo spots that occupy the high traffic volume of social platforms. Since being photographed by an Internet celebrity at the end of 2021, it has attracted countless tourists. "On May Day, one kilometer of road can be blocked for several hours."

;

;Xiao Na and the young people in the stall area They originally worked in the county or around Ningde City. After their hometown became a tourist attraction in the past two years, they came back to set up stalls. "No matter how much or how little you earn, at least you have more freedom." Xiaona's husband also came back to work as a photo guide, using his home An idle small off-road vehicle will charge 150 yuan to pick up passengers from Xiawei Island to another nearby scenic spot, the lighthouse; if it is a chartered vehicle, the price per day is 600 yuan, and you can choose Donghai Line 1 or Sansha Dongbi Line.

;

;It only takes two days to visit all the popular photography spots in Kasumigaura, and most tour groups’ itineraries are customized within two or three days. Xiaona has heard from many tourists that a three-day and two-night tour that includes transportation, food, and accommodation only costs more than a thousand yuan. “But the tour group doesn’t care about the weather and tides, and skips some spots if you can’t see them. ”

;

;;

;

;In the planning of Huazhu Village, the appearance of the B&B should retain the unique stone house style of southern Fujian;(Southern People Weekly reporter Nie Yang Xin/Picture);

;

;Uneven

;

;The most common thing Ou Shao of Beiqi Village hears from tourists is, "Why is it different here from the photos?" ”所以他现在见到游客会提前说明，“到霞浦玩一定要注意天气，天气好跟坏，拍照天差地别。”

;

;在郑德雄看来，摄影点和旅游点本身It’s just different. “Some tourists come to the photography spot and feel that there is nothing to see, because photography has requirements on time and light.” The aesthetic perspectives of photographers and tourists are also different. The photographer was on the highway bridge on the east wall. There are three types of landscapes you can take pictures of - the grand landscape of the sunset, the seaweed net on the lake and the lines of the tidal flats under the bridge, but tourists generally only look at the sunset.

;

;Ye Yu, who sells coffee under the observation deck of Huazhu Village, remembers that no one in the village cared about the sunrise before. When fishermen go out to catch fish, they go out at high tide and return at high tide. They look at the tide table, which has nothing to do with sunrise and sunset. On New Year's Day in 2013, CCTV broadcast the sunrise live in Huazhu, which earned Huazhu the title of "China's Sun Viewing Landmark." The sunrise footage captured by CCTV was posted on the wall under the observation deck, and a stone tablet was erected next to it: " How blessed to be in the same time and space as this sunrise." Ye Yu remembered that the CCTV sunrise was filmed by the staff who set up tents on the top of the mountain and lived there for a month.

;

;Beiqi Village was probably the first place to realize the different needs of tourism and photography. The Ou Shao family opened a B&B in the village in 2013, and began taking tourists out to sea for sightseeing and fishing entertainment in 2020. So far, it has developed nearly ten projects, including tourist charters, fishing outings, parent-child trips to the sea, sales of dried seafood, and cage nets. "The passenger flow here is unstable, so we can only develop more."

;

;Ou Shao's family used to be fishermen, and their income from fishing was unstable. "There are not so many fish now, and every May The fishing season is closed from the 1st to August 31st, and large boats can park on the shore." They considered daily fishing and tourism during the fishing season, and found that it was not cost-effective to only do it for three months. "Do it all year round. If you do this, you will accumulate many old customers." So they concentrated on the tourism industry.

;

;Ou Shao’s father now goes out to sea to fish, always accompanying guests on a chartered boat. The price of chartering a boat is 600 yuan, and the catch is uncertain. “It’s okay to catch more or less. Some tourists are Those who have come from the inland have never seen the sea and find it very fresh."

;

;More tourists choose to spend 30 yuan to take a 20-minute boat ride to see the seaweed that has been planted on the edge of the inland sea. The Ou Shao family built a new boat in May 2023, costing 50,000 to 60,000 yuan. The cabin area was specially enlarged to accommodate up to 30 people. There are several families involved in the boat tour project in the village, including Ou Shao's relatives.

;

;When Ou Shao was soliciting tourists at the beach, an electric bicycle rode on the village road and he also talked to the tourists on the roadside. I asked Ou Shao, "Is that your relative or a competitor?" Ou Shao replied: "It's my relative and a competitor."

;

;The two of them stood guard in front of the entrance of the seaside parking lot, taking turns. Go up and ask the private car coming in.

;

;;

;

;Uncle Zhang is making fire hoses for a B&B by hand. He believes that returning to his hometown to build a B&B is a feeling for his hometown;(Southern Characters Weekly reporter Nie Yangxin/photo);

;

;Under construction

;

;Not all famous photography spots can catch up with the tourism boom. Xiaohao Beach is the earliest famous, but the surrounding areas The supporting facilities and B&B design are lagging behind those of Dongbi and Huazhu on the same line. The B&Bs in Xiaohao Village are concentrated in the new area on the edge of the old village. A large open space from the new area to the seaside is filled with sand, gravel, soil, fishing nets, construction waste and domestic garbage.

;

;The B&Bs in Xiaohao Village are mainly self-built houses in rural areas. Villagers rent and sell spare rooms in their own houses. The decoration style of the rooms is basically the bedrooms of ordinary commercial houses. In order to reduce the difficulty of cleaning, a pile of public slippers are placed at the door of each B&B for guests to change into. Such a room costs 300 yuan a night.

;

;Muhai B&B is one of the few boutique B&Bs currently in operation. It has floor-to-ceiling glass windows facing the sea and a small outdoor garden. The proprietress Wu Sister-in-law said that the design fee for the B&B cost 60,000 yuan. . Sister-in-law Wu’s husband is a village cadre. When the houses in the new district first started to be decorated in 2018, he suggested that the villagers decorate them in the style of a B&B, but the villagers were unwilling. Sister-in-law Wu said, “Someone asked at that time, and I bought it after all the hard work. If you decorate a house yourself and enjoy it, why should you let others live in it? By the time they want to think about a B&B again, it will be too late."

;

;Sister-in-law Wu's B&B will open in 2021, and only 5 of the two floors have been repaired. In the peak season, the price of a suite and bathtub room is as high as thousands of yuan per night, but in the off-season, there are almost no guests. She believes that the supporting facilities around Xiaohao Village have affected the development of B&Bs. “There used to be a parking lot that could park 70 cars, and the roads were beautifully built, but it was demolished in 2021 and has not been built yet.”

;

;Since 2021, Xiaohao Village has been caught in a storm of accountability for illegal land occupation and illegal construction in rural areas. After investigation and verification by relevant departments, Xiaohao Village actually built 121 homesteads, of which 61 were built by non-village personnel. It also introduced commercial health care projects and occupied 16 homesteads. In March 2022, information released by relevant departments at higher levels stated that "all illegally sold collective land has been taken back to the village collective, and the land will be restored to its original state after demolition." The villagers also don't know what will happen to this empty land filled with waste. .

;

;Natural conditions also restrict the development of some photography spots. Although the Xiawei Island Sea Cave is popular, it can only be revealed after low tide. Tourists who want to take pictures have to climb down the seaside rocks with bare hands. A warm reminder in the "Xiapu Photography Guide", "The reefs on the shore are easily slippery due to corrosion by sea water. It is recommended to wear non-slip shoes and walk slowly. Elderly people with limited mobility should not go there."

;

;Sea caves are equipped with The rescue workers said, "Every day, tourists slip off the rocks and fall into the sea." The scenic spot originally wanted to build a wooden boardwalk, but the rocks were severely corroded and broke when nails were hammered in, so they had to give up. "Do you know why the scenic spot doesn't charge admission tickets? If it does, the compensation (if something happens) will be up to the sky."

;

;It is nearly 50 kilometers from the county seat to Xiamei Island, and there is a long stretch of road in the middle. It is a gentle mountain road. In recent years, a new road has been built close to the coastline. This road is open even before it is included in the map navigation. Just like the tourism industry here, it seems that it has not yet been completed, but the reception of tourists has already begun.

;The fate that every new owner cannot escape is to deal with and confront the property. This is his homework and his of practice.

;

;Since I took over the house and became an owner in October last year, I have started to form a front with my neighbors and compete with the property management. Today, the team has collapsed, losing ground, and the rights protection has ended in failure. It's the same as the mental process of decorating, from being full of emotions to being discouraged, and finally giving up.

;

;When the house was handed over for inspection, the quality of the house was worrying and many areas needed repairs. However, the developer did not do anything and delayed to solve most of the problems. Until now, the paint surface of the corner of my second bedroom is cracked. The seam is still there intact. This is indeed the developer's problem. The property management company can only help me communicate my needs, but they belong to the same company, and the property management company has collected property fees early. I have to discuss an explanation with the property management company. It is not unfair at all to take the blame.

;

;In the process of fighting with the property owners, each other's tactics also changed according to the other's actions, and they continued to see each other's progress and retreat. If the housekeeper responds politely and politely, I will also communicate politely. If I am tougher, she will get angry at me. More often than not, the housekeeper will use low-grade deception, but I can't expose her directly. I have to leave a little kindness so that we can meet each other in the future and everything can be discussed. She told lies and fully accepted my needs, saying that she would urge and reflect them, but my problems would not be advanced or solved. She treats me as a fool. If she can evade something, she will do it first. Later problems will be dealt with later. The rhetoric will always be dealt with in a unified manner later. In the end, he couldn't do anything perfunctorily and ran out of patience. The housekeeper simply stopped making excuses and played the emotional card. She admitted that the developers were rogue and the property management companies were rogue. She only received a salary of a few dollars a month, so how could she have the final say? Without pretending, I was moved by her words that were completely embarrassing, and I began to accept in my heart that this was the end.

;

;Before I paid the property fee, I had to ask the housekeeper to get the key when I opened the door of my house. The owner of the owner group once privately suggested that I replace the lock cylinder and argue with the property management company about when to solve the problem and when to pay. . I didn't want to take an extreme approach, and I was eager to get a property certificate to install charging piles, so I had no choice but to surrender. Once the money is handed over, it becomes even more difficult to ask them to do something.

;

;Based on this year’s negotiations and observations, I found that one of the main job responsibilities of the property management company is to collect fees. As early as September, before the previous year's property fees were due, the housekeeper started a show of fancy reminders to pay the next year's property fees. Taking advantage of the fact that the owners were at home at night, the housekeepers divided their forces and went door to door to collect property fees. Everyone among the owners condemned this behavior of only enjoying rights without assuming obligations. A few days later, the property management company sent out a notice with bait, offering free rice and cooking oil if the property management fee was paid during this period. So, I often see the housekeeper walking in the community carrying grain and oil, and watching her retreating back, I wonder, if the execution of solving problems is so touching, why are we here?

;

;After a year of fighting, my interest in fighting for the rights of my neighbors has slowly cooled down. Recently, there have been voices in the group that want to replace the property, but I no longer have such high expectations for the final result. Confrontation between property owners and property owners has become the norm. I am afraid that my property and I, as well as the domestic property management industry, still have a long, long way to go.

;
